Comments_List: Increased knowledge of Modern Greek Language: vocabulary, grammar, and culture
My modern Greek oral and writing skills.
More advanced grammar (including genitive) and specific vocabulary

We delved far deeper into Greek grammar than we ever have before and started reading more advanced Greek texts. This activity of reading literature in which we do not already know all the vocabulary pushed us and challenged us as learners and thinkers.
I learned a higher level of conversational Greek and some more complicated terms, grammatical constructs, and nuances of the language.

Maria structures this course very well for learning and feedback. We practice the grammar and vocabulary until it becomes natural (and it helps that the class is every day). It would help if there were more oral practice/assessment.
I think that all students could benefit from more frequent oral interviewing, perhaps included into part of the grade.
I loved almost everything about this class. It was consistently the part of my day I looked forward to and there's very little about this experience that I'd want to change.
Yes, Ms. Kaliambou is the best professor I have had at Yale; she genuinely cares about both the well-being and learning of her students.
Yes, Maria is an amazing professor and you will learn so much!
If you are interested in learning modern Greek, yes! Maria is a wonderful professor.

Absolutely! Modern Greek classes are typically small class sizes, so you get to form a very close-knit community.The classroom is a comfortable environment to learn, which makes it enjoyable to come to class. We participate in a variety of classroom activities during each class period and each activity sharpens a different aspect of our language learning skills (e.g. listening, speaking, writing, reading).
For sure. Anybody who wants to learn Modern Greek will find it to be a delightful series of language classes.
